1.long: (a) I send for, summon, invite, (b) I beseech, entreat, beg, (c) I exhort, admonish, (d) I comfort, encourage, console.
a brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.

1.brief: I bring, present, come up to and stand by
1.long: I bring, present, prove, come up to and stand by, am present.
body, flesh; the body of the Church.
abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering.
set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred.
(a) reasonable, rational, (b) metaphorical, as contrasted with the literal.
service rendered to God, perhaps simply: worship.

2.brief: an age, a cycle of time
2.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.
renewing; a renewal or change of heart and life.
the mind, the reason, the reasoning faculty, intellect.
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

2.brief: I put to the test, prove, examine
2.long: I put to the test, prove, examine; I distinguish by testing, approve after testing; I am fit.
an act of will, will; plur: wishes, desires.
intrinsically good, good in nature, good whether it be seen to be so or not, the widest and most colorless of all words with this meaning.
perfect, (a) complete in all its parts, (b) full grown, of full age, (c) specially of the completeness of Christian character.

a calling for, summons, hence: (a) exhortation, (b) entreaty, (c) encouragement, joy, gladness, (d) consolation, comfort.
